channel.title: Nital : An Excellent Framework
channel.description:
[b]Nital[/b] is an effort to provide a well documented, powerful, scalable, and robust RuneScape server framework delivered open-source to all users.
[b]Advantages[/b]
[ul][li]Well designed architecture[/li] [li]Fast networking implementation (using the jBoss Netty API)[/li] [li]Thread-safe entity encapsulation[/li] [li]Simple entity representation[/li] [li]Visibly clear implementations of activator components[/li][/ul]
[b]Disadvantages[/b]
[ul][li]Restrictions to developers, without modification of the core code. For instance, when retrieving a world load result, attachment naming is critical, and multiple attachments may be associated with the same key, yet element grabbing only retrieves the first associated value.[/li][/ul]
[b]Credits[/b]
[ul][li][u]Thomas Nappo[/u] for critical mainstream development of the framework, along with engineering and all testing.[/li] [li][u]Graham Edgecombe[/u] for ideas which were implemented in different ways (such as the entity list collection) and utilities, along with design pattern ideas.[/li] [li][u]Steven Galarza[/u] for technical knowledge which was provided at request.[/li] [li][u]light232[/u] for advice and ingenious design patterns and architecture.[/li][/ul]
[url=http://nital.us]Get Nital[/url] (b-[i]alpha0.48[/i]) [url=https://github.com/Canownueasy/Nital]Visit Repository[/url]
[b][ STAFF NOTICE ([i]read[/i]) ][/b] This thread is provided in this section as it does contain content to download, however is still in it's development stage. Should this thread not meet the requirements of this section, please [b]do not[/b] remove the thread but rather move it to an appropriate section. Thanks :-)

item.title: Nital : An Excellent Framework
item.dc:creator: @Diligo_Deum Diligo Deum
item.description:
@Diligo_Deum wrote:

Nital is an effort to provide a well documented, powerful, scalable, and robust RuneScape server framework delivered open-source to all users.

Advantages

[ul][li]Well designed architecture[/li]
[li]Fast networking implementation (using the jBoss Netty API)[/li]
[li]Thread-safe entity encapsulation[/li]
[li]Simple entity representation[/li]
[li]Visibly clear implementations of activator components[/li][/ul]

Disadvantages

[ul][li]Restrictions to developers, without modification of the core code. For instance, when retrieving a world load result, attachment naming is critical, and multiple attachments may be associated with the same key, yet element grabbing only retrieves the first associated value.[/li][/ul]

Credits

[ul][li]Thomas Nappo for critical mainstream development of the framework, along with engineering and all testing.[/li]
[li]Graham Edgecombe for ideas which were implemented in different ways (such as the entity list collection) and utilities, along with design pattern ideas.[/li]
[li]Steven Galarza for technical knowledge which was provided at request.[/li]
[li]light232 for advice and ingenious design patterns and architecture.[/li][/ul]

Get Nital (b-alpha0.48)
